title: Inside This Issue
summary: The Quo Warranto case ruled that a public official could oust an administrative authority with a private attorney unless they had standing. Fire departments are recommended to have the governing board handle PRA matters while the Fire Chief handles administrative duties.
keywords: Permanence and Stability of Work Order
Shoreline Community College v. City of Tacoma
compressed_content: - Public officials cannot oust administrative authorities without standing. - Fire departments should delegate PRA matters to the governing board. - PERC deferrals are common in labor disputes.
search_text: Date: January 20, 2020 Open Puzzles - What’s That?, The Board and the Fire Chief: Who’s Responsible for What? (Part 1) Quo Warranto – What’s That?, The Board and the Fire Chief: Who’s Responsible for What? (Part II) How to Prepare for a Public Litigation Case, The Board and the Fire Chief: Who’s Responsible for What? (Part III) Actual Function of the Fire Chief, The Board and the Fire Chief - Who’s Responsible for What? (Part IV) The Budget/Financial Issues, The Board and the Fire Chief - Who’s Responsible for What? (Part V) Procurement/Purchasing, The Board and the Fire Chief - Who’s Responsible for What? (Part VI) Personnel Decisions, The Board and the Fire Chief - Who’s Responsible for What? (Part VII) Resolutions.
